questions.question_text: A small team is overloaded with requests for database resources. The Chief Information Officer (CIO) is concerned the company does not have the resources to deploy and manage these additional services efficiently. Which of the following types of cloud services would be the MOST effective?

discussion.content: Apparently when in doubt choose the answer you never heard of!
BaaS is Backend as a Service. Part of this Vendor supplies Database Management. I believe the answer given is correct

on the actual exam this question would be weighed as 0%. I am 99.999% this question and similar ones not covered are for statistical purposes on comptia exams. It simply isn't in the exam topics, even if you got it right in real exam you'd get 0%.
Answer is correct. BaaS: Bullshit as a Service
...this is why i love ExamTopics

comments.content:
Neverheard of it and I have AWS Pro
!

discussion.content: didn't even heard of this while studying for AWS cloud practitioner

Backend as a service (BaaS) | LinkedIn Learning, formerly ...
www.linkedin.com â€º backend-as-a-service-baas
AWS and serverless applications - [Narrator] Backend as a Service is quite an old concept. It's been around for a long time. Amazon S3 was one of the first Backend as a Service systems
I didnt know BaaS was a thing. The Netork + text book I have only discusses IaaS PaaS SaaS XaaS.

comments.content:
No..the question is saying the company does "NOT have the resources to deploy and manage" meaning they don't have the necessary infrastructure for a IaaS. 

Although BaaS isn't in the CompTIA Network+ objectives, the given answer is correct. Check this out. 

https://www.cloudflare.com/learning/serverless/glossary/backend-as-a-service-baas/

discussion.content: resources to "deploy and manage" associates with IaaS

OTDR is the most correct solution. The wording of the question gives it away; an optical time-domain reflectometer will help you find faults in a fiber line.
A light meter is incorrect; the technician has already established light levels are sufficient.
A tone generator is incorrect; the technician would need to go to the far end of the fiber to verify tone. Still, it is established that light levels are sufficient.
CSU/DSU is incorrect. A Channel service unit/data service unit connects serial ports on a router to an ISP's network and to the demarc.

An Optical Time Domain Reflectometer (OTDR) is an important instrument used by organizations to certify the performance of new fiber optics links and detect problems with existing fiber links.

reference: https://www.flukenetworks.com/expertise/learn-about/otdr#:~:text=An%20Optical%20Time%20Domain%20Reflectometer,problems%20with%20existing%20fiber%20links.

questions.question_text: A technician is troubleshooting a point-to-point fiber-optic connection. The technician is at a remote site and has no connectivity to the main site. The technician confirms the switch and the send-and-receive light levels are within acceptable range. Both fiber SFPs are confirmed as working. Which of the following should the technician use to reveal the location of the fault?

choices.A: Establish a plan to reset the company router.
choices.C: Duplicate the issue and continue testing.
choices.B: Escalate the issue to the server administrator.
choices.D: Report that an issue was not identified.

discussion.content:
According to COMPTIA troubleshooting methodology, he is still identifying the problem. He gathered information, so the next step is to duplicate the problem. Establishing a plan is way after.

1. Identify the Problem
Gather information
Duplicate the problem
Question users
Identify the symptoms
Determine if anything has changed
Define individual problems clearly
2. Develop a Theory
3. Test the Theory
4. Plan of Action

The answer is right. You need to be sure the erro is still happening before escalate, you need at least duplicate the erro, trying to open the website. In those try's he did before, just checked ping, tracert and telnet, he did not try access like a customer or user.

this question was in real exam i took a month ago..i chose B
need more clarification why the answer is C?
I gues he is suppose to keep testing to waste company's time and resources for the heck of it! Thanks CompTIA!!

comments.content: Why would he escalate, if everything is working?

discussion.content: I strongly believe that the next step should be escalation. There's no way he is going to duplicate a problem he hasn't even been able to identify.

comments.content: He received a report of the problem

"and then runs Telnet to port 80 and receives a response".
telnet is on port 23, port 80 is http

You can use telnet to test for connectivity to any port, just the same way you use netcat.
Forexample, in that case, he could have used: [telnet 192.x.x.x 80] <== This commands tests for connectivity to port 80

discussion.content: This makes no sense. How is he supposed to duplicate the problem when he doesn't even know what the problem is yet?
The network technican verified that it is not a network problem. Why should he try to duplicate the intranet webserver and continue testing instead of escalating.... makes no sense to me

comments.content: the question is more a twist on the troubleshooting methodology than solving the problem - in reality i would check if the IIS service is running on the web server

questions.question_text: A network technician receives a report that the company's intranet web server is not responding. The technician verifies successful connectivity to the server via the ping and tracert commands. The technician also verifies the routers and switches are online and operational, and then runs Telnet to port 80 and receives a response. Which of the following troubleshooting steps should the technician perform NEXT?
A technician needs to connect two routers using copper cables. Which of the following cables would utilize both the TIA/EIA 568a and TIA/EIA 568b standards?

discussion.content:
Straight-Through different device
Crossover same device

I don't agree - if the old network card is working - even if the drivers and firmware are outdated the link lights would light up when plugged in unless the switch port speed and duplex are not set to auto - if its set too high like 1000 full you will not get a link on the legacy PC network card
What is network card driver? Can someone explain me please
Answer is correct. You can still ping loopback address without a network card, so it's possible the computer has a fried or outdated card.
I think is A and B, others the light will be on
I'm gonna go with A and B solely because of this similar question: https://www.professormesser.com/free-a-plus-training/a-plus-pop-quizzes/thats-a-really-bad-mismatch/2/

Caden's suggestion is OK, in my opinion. 
Network card drivers are tested through pinging the loopback address and these drivers must be OK.
The network connection should not be dependent on firmware version.
Also, protocols the legacy computer supports, this cannot be true, because for the connectivity, when you have a network card with ethernet port, your connection should work. I think the answer is A and D. D, because this PC could be configured with another IP settings

For speed mismatch, the links will not light up. 
For duplex mismatch , the links may still light up, but with degraded network performance

Surely A is a possible answer. no?
I used to be encountered the connectivity issue due to the outdated driver. So, I think the answer is correct.

questions.question_text: The engineering department wants to bring a legacy computer online to test a failed component. When patching the device into the switch, there are no link lights or connectivity. The legacy computer can ping its loopback address successfully. Another device can connect to that same port without issues. Which of the following should the network technician check NEXT? (Choose two.)
